testCases.explanation: No cooldown needed, just execute all 6 tasks: A→B→A→B→A→B = 6 intervals.
All tasks are distinct and only appear once. No cooldown conflicts. Total = 3 intervals.
A,B,C each appear 3 times; D appears twice; E once. Schedule fits without idle: A→B→C→A→B→C→A→B→C→D→D→E = 12.

description:
You are given an array of CPU `tasks`, each labeled with a letter from A to Z, and a number `n`. Each CPU interval can be idle or allow the completion of one task. Tasks can be completed in any order, but there is a cooldown interval of length `n` between two tasks with the same label.

Return the minimum number of CPU intervals required to complete all the given tasks.

See the full problem on [LeetCode 621](https://leetcode.com/problems/task-scheduler/).

examples.explanation: A -> B -> idle -> A -> B -> idle -> A -> B
On this case any permutation of size 6 would work since n = 0. For example, A -> A -> A -> B -> B -> B.
One possible solution is: A -> B -> C -> A -> D -> E -> A -> F -> G -> A -> idle -> idle -> A -> idle -> idle -> A.

constraints: tasks[i] is an uppercase English letter
